item.title: 562 compile error!
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“DuhPk, post:2, topic:357956”]Replace yours with mine and it should work

[code]package com.rs2hd.content;

import com.rs2hd.model.Equipment;
import com.rs2hd.model.Item;
import com.rs2hd.model.Player;
import com.rs2hd.model.Skills;

/**

  • Handles skill cape trimming.
  • @author Caelum

*/
public class TrimCape {

            public boolean isSkillcape(final int capeId) {
                    switch(capeId) {
                    case 9747:
                    case 9753:
                    case 9750:
                    case 9768:
                    case 9756:
                    case 9759:
                    case 9762:
                            return true;
                    }
                            return false;
                    }
           
    /**
     * Handles a skill cape emote: checks appropriate levels,
     * finds the correct animation + graphic, etc.
     * @param player
     */
    public static void trim(Player player) {
            Item cape = player.getEquipment().get(Equipment.SLOT_CAPE);
            if(player.maxedSkills > 2) {
                    cape.getId() += 1;
            } else {
                    cape.getId();
    }

}[/code][/quote]
You could at least tell him what his problem was so he can actually learn something.

        public static void trim(Player player) {
                Item cape = player.getEquipment().get(Equipment.SLOT_CAPE);
                if(player.maxedSkills > 2) {
                        cape.getId() + 1;
                } else {
                        cape.getId();

This was your method, first thing you needed an equals sign on this line,

cape.getId() + 1;

Should have been

cape.getId() += 1;

Because when you have cape.getId() + 1 you’re saying, “Get the data from cape.getId() and add 1”.
But this doesn’t assign it back to itself.

You would have to do this,

cape.getId() = cape.getId() + 1;

As now you’re assigning it back to itself.

But, when you have [i]cape.getId() += 1 you’re saying “Get the data from cape.getId() and assign 1”. It does the same as

cape.getId() = cape.getId() + 1;

but as a shortcut.

And your second problem you was missing two closing braces, it was closing the class before it was supposed to.

public static void trim(Player player) [b]{[/b] Item cape = player.getEquipment().get(Equipment.SLOT_CAPE); if(player.maxedSkills > 2) [b]{[/b] cape.getId() + 1; [b]}[/b] else [b]{[/b] cape.getId();
As you can see, you have two green braces, but you're missing the two other colors closing brace.

Fix’t.

public static void trim(Player player) [b]{[/b] Item cape = player.getEquipment().get(Equipment.SLOT_CAPE); if(player.maxedSkills > 2) [b]{[/b] cape.getId() += 1; [b]}[/b] else [b]{[/b] cape.getId(); [b]}[/b] [b]}[/b]

Read full topic

item.title: 562 compile error!
item.dc:creator: @DuhPk DuhPk
item.description:
@DuhPk wrote:

Replace yours with mine and it should work

[code]package com.rs2hd.content;

import com.rs2hd.model.Equipment;
import com.rs2hd.model.Item;
import com.rs2hd.model.Player;
import com.rs2hd.model.Skills;

/**

  • Handles skill cape trimming.
  • @author Caelum

*/
public class TrimCape {

            public boolean isSkillcape(final int capeId) {
                    switch(capeId) {
                    case 9747:
                    case 9753:
                    case 9750:
                    case 9768:
                    case 9756:
                    case 9759:
                    case 9762:
                            return true;
                    }
                            return false;
                    }
           
    /**
     * Handles a skill cape emote: checks appropriate levels,
     * finds the correct animation + graphic, etc.
     * @param player
     */
    public static void trim(Player player) {
            Item cape = player.getEquipment().get(Equipment.SLOT_CAPE);
            if(player.maxedSkills > 2) {
                    cape.getId() += 1;
            } else {
                    cape.getId();
    }

}[/code]

item.title: 562 compile error!
item.dc:creator: @riches321 riches321
item.description:
@riches321 wrote:

i get a trim cape error this is my trim cape file

[code]package com.rs2hd.content;

import com.rs2hd.model.Equipment;
import com.rs2hd.model.Item;
import com.rs2hd.model.Player;
import com.rs2hd.model.Skills;

/**

  • Handles skill cape trimming.
  • @author Caelum

*/
public class TrimCape {

	public boolean isSkillcape(final int capeId) {
		switch(capeId) {
		case 9747:
		case 9753:
		case 9750:
		case 9768:
		case 9756:
		case 9759:
		case 9762:
			return true;
		}
			return false;
		}
	
/**
 * Handles a skill cape emote: checks appropriate levels,
 * finds the correct animation + graphic, etc.
 * @param player
 */
public static void trim(Player player) {
	Item cape = player.getEquipment().get(Equipment.SLOT_CAPE);
	if(player.maxedSkills > 2) {
		cape.getId() + 1;
	} else {
		cape.getId();
}[/code]

this is the error’s i have

Compling content.... src\com\rs2hd\content\TrimCape.java:37: not a statement cape.getId() + 1; ^ src\com\rs2hd\content\TrimCape.java:40: reached end of file while parsing } ^ 2 errors Compiling model...
